column1: Hot Spots Unit Risk and Cancer Potency Values

column2: Listed by ARB as “Particulate Matter from Diesel-Fueled Engines”
Scientific Review Panel unit risk “reasonable estimate” = 3.0 E-4 (μg/m3) -1.
Range of unit risks in TAC document was 1.3 E-4 – 2.4 E-3 (μg/m3) -1.
Nickel refinery dust and nickel subsulfide are in Class A
can be calculated using PEF factors contained in the benzo[a]pyrene
See PCB chemical summary for risk categorization and TEF factors
